newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Feb start expected for QMC magnesium plant.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Feb start expected for QMC magnesium plant.

text.p: Queensland state premier Rob Borbidge said on Thursday he expected work on Queensland Metals Corp Ltd's A$73 million magnesium pilot plant at Gladstone to start in the first week of February.
"I expect work on the pilot plant to be as early as the first week in February," Borbidge told a press conference.

Earlier, QMC and Normandy Mining Ltd announced a joint venture to develop QMC's magnesium metals project together with the Ford Motor Co and the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO) which will financially contribute to the project.
Borbidge also said the first stage of construction work on a A$700 million 90,000 tonnes a year commercial plant at Gladstone should begin in about 12 to 18 months time.
Borbidge said he was confident other big projects for Queensland would be announced this year.
Negotiations between the Queensland government and Comalco Ltd for an aluminium refinery based at Gladstone were still on track, he said.
"Negotiations (with Comalco) are well advanced but we realise we are up against tough competitors in Malaysia and Singapore," he said.
